glosses: To intend or to vow to make an offering or an oblation to a power that is believed to be sacred for the purpose of making a wish come true.
To sacrifice something or oneself for something one holds valuable; to dedicate, to devote.

examples.translation: She devoted her whole life to her son.

glosses: (figurative) To be intensely occupied with something, to devote oneself to something.

examples.translation: to devote oneself to one's work

glosses: (figurative) To address a literary or musical work to someone as a sign of respect or affection; to dedicate.
(figurative) To allocate, to reserve, to earmark something for particular purpose.

etymology: From Proto-Turkic *atā- (“to give name, to make a promise, to affiance, to beckon”), which was derived from Proto-Turkic *āt (“name”) combined with the suffix Proto-Turkic *-(g)A. Doublet of atamak.
